etymologies: late Middle English: plural of mew, originally referring to the royal stables on the site of the hawk mews at Charing Cross, London. The sense ‘converted dwellings’ dates from the early 19th century

definitions: a row or street of houses or apartments that have been converted from stables or built to look like former stables
shortDefinitions: row or street of houses or flats that have been converted from stables

definitions: a group of stables, typically with rooms above, built around a yard or along an alley.
shortDefinitions: group of stables built round yard or along alley
